fr.upmc.r2d2.boards

Class AbstractTeleoperationBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • fr.upmc.r2d2.boards.AbstractTeleoperationBoard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.upmc.dtgui.gui.RobotTeleoperationBoard, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public abstract class AbstractTeleoperationBoard
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements fr.upmc.dtgui.gui.RobotTeleoperationBoard
    The class RobotTeleoperationBoard implements a teleoperation panel for a little robot. It is separated into three areas: an energy level display, a speed control display and a steering control display. The two control panel are themselves composed of two subpanels, one for displaying the current value and the other to allow for changing this value. For readability reasons (Swing does not provide good widgets to show a value with a clear scale besides a slider bar), both of these panels use slider bars. In the subpanel displaying the current value, actions on the slider bar are not activated.

    Invariant

     invariant      true

    Created on : 2011-09-19

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
